description:
It’s unclear if Don Lemon thinks before he opens his mouth, but he does Selena Gomez no favors, as she faces a backlash of national embarrassment.

Yesterday, Gomez posted a video of some crocodile tears as she whined about the Trump Administration deporting the scumiest criminals among us. And while the video did not convince anyone of anything other than how naive she truly is, the last thing she needed was Lemon to act as her defense attorney.

Don Lemon DEFENDS Selena Gomez following backlash over her tearful migrant deportation video.

“She cannot post online how she feels about deportation and immigration? Without being made fun of by the far right or the MAGA folks?”

pic.twitter.com/EsxUBfAWVM
— Ol
title: Don Lemon defends Selena Gomez's meltdown, claims mocking her is "Not what America is about"

description:
While America will not miss their least favorite DEI pick, White House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt took down the media at her first press briefing.

AP’s @ZekeJMiller: “A question that we've asked your predecessors of both parties in this job. When you're up here in this Briefing Room speaking to the American public. Do you view yourself and your role as speaking on, advocating on behalf of the president or providing the… pic.twitter.com/1X8dM0F2IV
— Curtis Houck (@CurtisHouck) January 28, 2025
title: Watch: The Trump Admin held their first press briefing where Karoline Leavitt unleashed berserker fury on the MSM

description:
We’re all (not) gonna die!

I apologize to everyone who came to this article and thought, for even a moment, that we were going to die.
title: Oh no, you guys! "The Science" has moved the Doomsday Clock and we're closer to "global disaster" than ever before

description:
If you want to know why society should stop glorifying mental illness it’s because of stories like this.

Nearly 500-pound rapper Dank Demoss has filed a lawsuit against Lyft after a driver refused her service because he was worried about the load on his tires.

NEW: 489 pound rapper Dank Demoss has launched a lawsuit against Lyft after one of their drivers denied her a ride because he said she wouldn’t fit in his car.

The driver was apparently worried that his car wouldn’t be able to handle her weight.

Demoss claims in her lawsuit… pic.twitter.com/rOQ8Sj4XuM
— Collin Rugg (@CollinRugg) January 28, 2025
title: Morbidly Obese Influencer Files Lawsuit Against Lyft After Driver Refuses Services

description:
Trump has announced his intent to abolish income tax. Today’s show breaks down the history of income tax in America and why it’s possible to abolish it.

- YouTube
title: Watch: Here's how Donald Trump CAN abolish America's income tax

description:
Jim Acosta was pulled from CNN’s programming yesterday. President Donald Trump continues to sign executive orders designed to weed out wokeness from the federal government. A Mug Club Undercover journalist was denied entry to a public drag show at Oscar Blues in Colorado. China’s DeepSeek artificial intelligence is threatening to upend ChatGPT and others. We’re looking at the history of income tax in America and why it’s possible to abolish it. And more!

TIME TO CLOSE JIM ACOSTA
title: Sources: Trump's DeepSeek AI Warning Explained & His Quest to Eliminate Income Tax

description:
In case you haven't heard, Donald Trump started the mass deportations on Day One. Many a progressive tear has been shed, and many a leftist meltdown has been mocked and ridiculed as these violent criminals are sent back to their home countries. Trump is doing what he said he was going to do. Promises made, promises kept. Know what I mean?

However, while we've been focused on who is being sent back, there hasn't been as much about who is trying to cross over. According to reporter Bill Melugin, that's because there aren't many people trying to cross over to report on. And he would know. The reason WE know there was a Biden Border Crisis is because Melugin was one of the fe
title: Reporter shares shocking IMMEDIATE effect Donald Trump has had on the border crisis: "I’ve never seen anything this low..."

description:
Let's spoil this from the jump. Your favorite clickbait engagement farmers are taking what Anthony Mackie said out of context and only showing you nine seconds of a longer clip. However, what he said was still dumb and pandering, and it doesn't bode well for a movie that's already been plagued with problems. The actor who plays Captain America says that "America" should not be one of the things that defines Captain America.

This was, of course, said in a country that wasn't America as part of a global press tour. Gotta pander to those foreign audiences!

Anthony Mackie explains what Captain America represents for him:

“Captain America represents a lot of different things & I don’t think the term ‘America’ should be one of those representations. It’s about a ma
title: Watch: "Captain America" actor claims Captain America shouldn't represent... America
